message: Any good reasons to use unit testing and adopt the Test Driven Developments? Real world examples are appreciated.  Thanks

data.message:
I'll tell my side of the story as I asked the same question and why bother spending time on writing tests rather than diving in the functionality code it self.

To summarize there is two major reasons I benefited from writing and maintain tests covered code:
1. On the process it self you will be forced to break down hypothetical function to testable small pieces witch actually eases later on writing the functionality it self 
Example : 
Write a function calls api retrieve data according to a parameter and returns filtered results according to another parameter.
 Tests:
1. Function exists
2. Can call api with 200 response 
3. If parameters type are wrong or undefined
Etc.. 
When your write your function later it will be a walk in a park because you're already know what to do.

2. Second major reason is simple to have as much as you can code base covered with tests so when every time you add one more feature you will make sure it doesn't ruin something else.
